titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ethel M. Martin Brooklyn nursing school collection 1996.001
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-10-14T15:48-0400

did.unittitle: Ethel M. Martin Brooklyn nursing school collection
did.abstract: Collection consists of two editions of The Echo, the Prospect Heights Hospital and Brooklyn Maternity Training School for Nurses yearbook (1928-1929), and The Nursing Bureau of Brooklyn, Inc.'s Articles of Incorporation and Terms of Agreement with Registrants (1933).

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Prospect Heights Hospital and Brooklyn Maternity (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: All items in the collection are in the public domain, with the exception of inscriptions in the 1928 yearbook. Those inscriptions will enter the public domain 70 years after the author's death, or in 2048 if the author's date of death is unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Ethel M. Martin Brooklyn nursing school collection, 1996.001, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated to the Brooklyn Historical Society by Linda Frank Beebes in 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of two editions of The Echo, the Prospect Heights Hospital and Brooklyn Maternity Training School for Nurses yearbook (1928-1929), and The Nursing Bureau of Brooklyn, Inc.'s Articles of Incorporation and Terms of Agreement with Registrants (1933). The items belonged to Ethel M. Martin, who attended the Prospect Heights Hospital and Brooklyn Maternity Training School for Nurses. The 1928 yearbook contains inscriptions from other students to Martin.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ethel M. (Martin) Franks (1907-2000), was born in Millville, New Brunswick, Canada, on February 10, 1907, to Margaret Galloway Maxwell and Percy Harry Charles Martin. She arrived in Brooklyn, NY, around 1927, to attend the Brooklyn Maternity Training School for Nurses at the Prospect Heights Hospital. While attending school she resided at the nurses' residence, which was attached to the hospital. She became a Registered Nurse in 1929. After graduation, she worked as a private and hospital nurse, and was a member of the nursing school's alumni association. She became a United States citizen in 1934. In 1935, she married Harold L. Franks and became a homemaker. In 1942, they moved to Pittsburgh. About 1963, she resumed her nursing career, and was employed by Planned Parenthood, the Head Start program, and the Allegheny County Public Health Department, from which she retired. She died in Miami, FL, on January 4, 2000.
- based on information provided by her daughter, Linda Franks Beebe
